comments: I loved her class so much and how much she cares about her field. She has so much knowledge to share beyond what is to be taught. Study the material, as she does do pop quizzes. Show your dedication for this class because she\'s quick to learn who doesn\'t care and awards those who do. She is personable and knows how to make a class laugh.

comments: Awesome professor, does a great job of explaining material. Just go to class and you\'ll learn what you need to for the tests. Read the tests questions carefully! Very intellectual person overall. If you do the work and extra credit and actually learn the material, you should get a solid A.

tag_professor: Amazing lectures (5)  Inspirational (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Respected (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)

comments: She is a great professor in ATS Anatomy at Sacramento State. She should teach another anatomy(or allied health class) next summer. She gives efficient informational lectures and reminds me when I have a pop quiz. The tests are easy to solve with a few difficult questions. Overall,if you study hard and put enough effort into the test,you will pass.

tag_professor: Amazing lectures (5)  Inspirational (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Respected (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: She is an amazing professor! I recommend taking a bio class, before her class though. She is not your average "eat this and be healthy" type of Nutrition professor, she really breaks down the science of how food fuels your body! Her class is tough but well worth it! side note, all her exams if there\'s an "all of the above" that\'s the right answer

comments: I love her personality. Extremely smart!! We took all tests online, sometimes there were questions that were not covered. Lectures were great. We were encouraged to ask questions and have real talk.

tag_professor: Amazing lectures (5)  Inspirational (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Respected (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: I love this teacher. She inspired me to go further into investigating my own health choices. She may be tough, but she literally tells you what you need to do to get a good grade in the class. It\'s not hard at all, just follow her guidelines.

tag_professor: Amazing lectures (5)  Inspirational (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Respected (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: Overall its pretty easy to get an A as long as you do all your homework and the ec. Be advised tho her tests are hard but she provides study guides which are really helpful at least for the first two exams. Spends a lot of time on the chemical part of the subject which is pretty dry.

tag_professor: Amazing lectures (5)  Inspirational (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Respected (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: I took her nutrition class last semester. Sandra has a great personality, is really smart and helpful, and really down to Earth.

tag_professor: Amazing lectures (5)  Inspirational (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Respected (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: This class requires a lot of hardwork and dedication! She knows exactly what she is teaching, so she is very meticulous about detail! If you do all of your homework and all of the extra credit you will receive an A. There is a lot of memorizing, but if you do all of the work you will definitely pass the class!

tag_professor: Amazing lectures (5)  Inspirational (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Respected (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: The textbook is optional, BUT DEFINITELY BUY IT!! The reader is good, but VERY brief. She expects much more detail than the reader. The textbook has very helpful practice problems and more detailed explanations. This class is not an easy A.

comments: I took one of your nutrition classes at Sac City about four years ago and I just wanted to say I loved your class and your teaching. comments: Easy A. Goes over test questions day before exam. Learned a bit, but noticed she doesn\'t like her intelligence being questioned, which she tends to flaunt rather poorly. On the plus side attendance is only required on test days. Grade is based on online quizzes (open note) and exams (based off online quizzes)

tag_professor: Amazing lectures (5)  Inspirational (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Respected (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: Pros: She seems like a professor you\'d like to have a beer with. Tries to keep the class interesting with personal stories. Class is an easy A. Cons: Knowledge of the material is low (review your anatomy). Too much bragging about her educational accomplishments. Treats the class like middle schoolers (this is a college level course!).

tag_professor: Amazing lectures (5)  Inspirational (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Respected (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: Very easy class. Reads questions directly from exams. Made many mistakes regarding anatomy and would often make stuff up when questioned. Loves to tell personal stories and brag about her credentials. This class was a disappointment. Recommend if you want an easy A, take someone else who\'s not doing this part-time.

tag_professor: Amazing lectures (5)  Inspirational (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (2)  Respected (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: Excellent class! She always provided examples that were easy to relate to, knows her subject well enough to answer any question, and provided many opportunities to improve. She has a genuine interest in helping her students improve their own health.
